p: The analysis of exposed mint plants showed the presence of toxic metals except for As. The value of As concentration detected in Mentha piperita was below the quantification limit of the method in root, stem, and leaves for both experiments (AsCd and AsCdNiPb), although the As content (23.7 mg/kg d.w.) which was added in soil reached the threshold intervention value (25 mg/kg d.w.).
